item.title: Professor Pranksman fools his students with a TA powered by IBM's Watson
item.description:
Professor Pranksman fools his students with a TA powered by IBM's Watson

Ashok Goel, a computer science professor at Georgia Institute of Technology, recently pulled a huge prank on his students: he gave them a robot for a teaching assistant. "Jill Watson" did regular TA work, like remind students of due dates and answer questions, all over email.

item.title: New Digital Face Manipulation Means You Can't Trust Video Anymore
item.description:
New Digital Face Manipulation Means You Can't Trust Video Anymore

18,514 0 What if you could alter a video of anyone to emulate facial and mouth movements that never existed in the source video-by yourself, at home, using a cheap webcam? Meet . Using RGB input from one video and mapped pixels from a second video, manipulating someone's face-including distinct facial and mouth movements-has become incredibly easy.

item.title: How Universal Basic Income Will Save Us From the Robot Uprising
item.description:
How Universal Basic Income Will Save Us From the Robot Uprising

Robots are poised to eliminate millions of jobs over the coming decades. We have to address the coming epidemic of "technological unemployment" if we're to avoid crippling levels of poverty and societal collapse. Here's how a guaranteed basic income will help - and why it's absolutely inevitable.

item.title: Watch Lytro Change Cinematography Forever
item.description:
Watch Lytro Change Cinematography Forever

The Lytro Cinema Camera could be the most groundbreaking development in cinematography since color motion picture film. We go "in-depth" with the entire Lytro system in this exclusive video. Full article: http://nofilmschool.com/2016/04/lytro-cinema-camera-cinematography-demo From No Film School's complete coverage of NAB 2016: http://nofilmschool.com/tags/nab-2016

item.title: AI doctors will become 'as ubiquitous as stethoscopes'
item.description:
AI doctors will become 'as ubiquitous as stethoscopes'

From helping humans live longer and hacking our performance, to repairing the body and understanding the brain, [i]WIRED Health will hear from the innovators transforming this critical sector. Read all of our WIRED Health coverage here.[/i] One of the biggest problems facing doctors isn't patients' injuries or illnesses - it's the sheer quantity data.

Robots are poised to eliminate millions of jobs over the coming decades. We have to address the coming epidemic of "technological unemployment" if we're to avoid crippling levels of poverty and societal collapse. Here's how a guaranteed basic income will help - and why it's absolutely inevitable.

item.title: Elon Musk: New version of Tesla Autopilot mind-blowing
item.description:
Elon Musk: New version of Tesla Autopilot mind-blowing

Despite federal investigations into a fatal Florida crash, Tesla CEO Elon Musk this week professed his deep faith in the rapid adoption of fully autonomous driving. Musk told investors Tesla was making significant strides in honing its Autopilot driver-assist system.

item.title: Nasa's secret art studio: how to make rocket science beautiful
item.description:
Nasa's secret art studio: how to make rocket science beautiful

If you've marveled at space news recently, there's a good chance it's thanks to the Jet Propulsion Laboratory. This arm of Nasa is responsible for the most ambitious of missions, like sending robots to Mars and, most recently, the Juno spacecraft to Jupiter.
